messages.content: Do you think current policies reflect the needs of employees?
Not entirely. For example, the policy on reimbursements is outdated. It assumes paper receipts and physical forms when everything else is digital now.
Any final advice for the organization?
Listen more deeply to employee feedback and don’t wait until someone resigns to ask how they’re doing.
Was the onboarding content relevant?
Only partially. Some sessions felt like generic compliance slides rather than real job prep.
Did you get feedback you can act on?
A little. It was mostly generic, “good job,” “keep it up” - but nothing concrete to work on.
What could we have done to make you stay?
A clearer growth path and more structured career conversations could have made a big difference. Also, more openness to internal transfers.
What did you enjoy the most during your time here?
The people. I’ve built friendships and learned so much from my peers. Also, the sense of purpose in some projects was deeply fulfilling.
How was your onboarding experience?
Decent, but slightly chaotic. Too much paperwork and not enough introduction to actual workflows.
Were you satisfied with the outcome?
No. I didn’t get the hike I expected, and there was no clarity on what to do differently.
How would you describe your team dynamics?

Our team dynamics are generally healthy. We communicate openly, and everyone pulls their weight. Sometimes, however, deadlines bring stress and people get short-tempered, but we usually resolve things quickly.
Are the company policies easy to understand and follow?
Some are clear, like leave and travel. Others, like hybrid work expectations, are vague. It feels like interpretation depends on the team you’re in.
How has your mental health evolved since joining this company?
Initially, I was enthusiastic and driven. But over time, the constant hustle and lack of downtime made me more anxious. I’ve had to consciously slow down and reprioritize.
Have you ever felt overlooked or dismissed by your manager?
Once or twice, yes, especially during performance reviews where I felt my input wasn’t fully considered.
